intro: Ruellia caroliniensis subsp. caroliniensis, commonly known as the Carolina roselight, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces showy blue to violet flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
